{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Cisco |model=M20 |revision= |upc=745883589388 |ean= |asin=B003B4AVSS |price= |est_release_date=03/31/2010 |fcc_date=01/25/2010 |manuf_country=China |manuf=CyberTAN |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-M20 |ic_id=3839A-M20 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4716B0 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4716B0 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53115 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware=DD-WRT,TomatoUSB |802dot11_protocols=bgn |addl_chips= |default_ssid=CiscoXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^Cisco[A-Z0-9]{5}$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=68:7F:74 |oui_eth=68:7F:74 }} {{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=M20|pid=01t80000003K7ZWAA0}} {{TechInfoDepot|Cisco_Valet_Plus_M20_1.0}} :The M20 shares the same hardware as the Linksys WRT310N v2. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cisco_Valet_Routers Cisco Valet Routers on Wikipedia]
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Cisco_Valet_Plus_M20 On the DD-WRT wiki] (listed as a WiP)
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=82679 On thread of many on the DD-WRT forums], pointing to [ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24-K26 Eko's recent builds] as supporting the M20, as of 09/08/2011 the latest build is [ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24-K26/svn17084/dd-wrt.v24-17084_NEWD-2_K2.6_mini_m20.bin 17804] To get HT40 support in the 17804 build, telnet into the router and run the following commands.. 
nvram set wl0_nbw_cap=1
nvram set wl1_nbw_cap=1
nvram commit
reboot
While the device is not listed on the support list, it works with TomatoUSB (K2.6 NoUSB-STD) as of 10/13/2011. "3763-02010206R" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. M20 serial numbers appear to start with '''CVK0'''. The default SSID is '''CiscoXXXXX''' where '''XXXXX''' is the last 5 digits of the serial number. If the device has been configured with Cisco Connect the device will probably have a [[Cisco Connect SSIDs|randomly generated SSID]]. A sample serial number is CVK01K427671 The included power adapter is a '''Bestec''' EA0121WAA. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cisco_Valet_Routers 'Cisco valet routers' on Wikipedia]
